intro: Epidendrum lansbergii, commonly known as the showy epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its long, arching stems and clusters of bright orange or yellow flowers with a distinctive red lip. The plant is epiphytic, meaning it grows on other plants without being parasitic, often found in humid, shaded environments.
